title: ollama/ollama
summary: Get up and running with Llama 3, Mistral, Gemma 2, and other large language models locally.

title: langchain-ai/langchain (Ollama integration)
summary: LangChain provides a built-in Ollama LLM wrapper for chaining, retrieval, agents, and more.

title: ollama-python
summary: Official Python client library for Ollama; chat, generate, embed, pull, and manage models.

title: ollama-js
summary: Official JavaScript/TypeScript client for Node, Deno, and browsers.

title: ollama-webui
summary: Feature-rich chat WebUI for Ollama (formerly Ollama-WebUI).

title: ollama4j
summary: Java/Kotlin client library for Ollama with Spring Boot starters.

title: ollama-cli
summary: Convenient Rust CLI wrapper around Ollama with TUI chat and model management.

title: ollama-copilot
summary: Turn any Ollama model into a GitHub Copilot-style code-completion backend.

title: ollama-rag
summary: Minimal RAG template using Ollama embeddings + Chroma vector DB.

title: ollama-haystack
summary: Haystack 2.x integration providing OllamaGenerator and OllamaChatGenerator components.

title: ollama-csharp
summary: .NET/C# client for Ollama with Blazor sample app.

title: ollama-helm
summary: Kubernetes Helm chart to deploy Ollama server and models at scale.

title: ollama-vscode
summary: VS Code extension that adds Ollama chat and code-generation panels.

title: ollama-rust
summary: Rust crate providing async bindings to the Ollama REST API.

title: ollama-gpt4all-ui
summary: GPT4All UI experimental branch that can plug into an Ollama server instead of llmodel.

title: ollama-dagger
summary: Dagger module for CI/CD pipelines that need to spin up Ollama services in containers.

title: ollama-rails
summary: Ruby gem embedding Ollama into Rails apps via background jobs.

title: ollama-discord
summary: Self-hostable Discord bot that brings Ollama models to any server.

title: ollama-go
summary: Idiomatic Go client for Ollama with generate/chat/embed helpers.

title: ollama-obsidian
summary: Obsidian plugin to run local LLM prompts inside your vault using Ollama.
